definition: to lock one's door and refuse to see sb

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Sense only the "maleficent contacts" and shut them out.
sentences.chinese: 只感知“有害接觸”並拒之門外。

sentences.english: In liberal education punishment no longer exists. Teachers and students are just like friends.
sentences.chinese: 開明教育也將懲戒體罰拒之門外，倡導師生如友。

sentences.english: But Joshua held him off with a shotgun.
sentences.chinese: 可喬舒亞用槍把他拒之門外。

sentences.english: He applied to art school in Vienna but was rejected.
sentences.chinese: 那時他申請了維也納的美術學院，但被拒之門外。

sentences.english: Many expectant mothers were crowded out of the maternity hospitals.
sentences.chinese: 很多臨產婦女由於孕婦過多而被婦產醫院拒之門外。

sentences.english: This time, the far-right party was rejected by Austrian voters by an even wider margin.
sentences.chinese: 這次，極右政黨以更大的差距被奧地利選民拒之門外。

sentences.english: Many reporters were turned away from the door.
In Japan, they closed the doors on me.
sentences.chinese: 在日本，大家把我拒之門外。

sentences.english: God knows what it is like to look to God and to have Heaven barred, apparently.
sentences.chinese: 上帝顯然知道那仰望上帝卻被天堂拒之門外的心情。

sentences.english: We could try to block each other out by keeping the innovation secret.
sentences.chinese: 但我們可以通過使創新得到保密而將對方拒之門外。
